text: Patriotism, when it wants to make itself felt in the domain of learning, is a dirty fellow who should be thrown out of doors.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

text: Love and business and family and religion and art and patriotism are nothing but shadows of words when a man's starving!
author: O. Henry

text: Politics is too partisan, and sometimes patriotism is cast aside. Patriotism is honor and love of your country and your brothers and sisters. With politics I get the impression that it's all about what's good for the party and not necessarily what's good for the country.
author: Ricardo Montalban

text: Look, I think Hispanic community - the values that resonate in our community are fundamentally conservative. They are faith, family and patriotism.
author: Ted Cruz

text: Unfortunately, after Sept. 11, there was an outburst in America of intense suffering and patriotism, and the Bush administration was very shrewd and effective in painting anyone who disagreed with the policies as unpatriotic or even traitorous.
author: Jimmy Carter
